basics.name: Ramanath Nayak
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer II
basics.summary: Over 9 years of experience in the backend development, data analysis/engineering, manufacturing strategy development and infrastructure automation.Experienced in agile methodology with excellent communication and leadership skills.

location.address: #26/1, Muniyamma lane, Kodihalli 6th cross, HAL 2nd stage

work.company: Zynga Game Network India Private Limited
work.summary: Lead developer for enabling GDPR compliance service across entire Zynga datalake and lead a team to build data quality framework for entire data lakehouse in Zynga.to build service which can handle requests in petabytes of data incoming into zynga dataservice
highlights: Feature spec development for enabling GDPR complaince for zynga and M&A studios
Technical spec development to scope out all the impacted downstream and upstream in the data pipline and datasource and additional service that needs to be developed
Airflow DAG development to support the GDPR requests globally
Implement DQ framework around Great expectations to enable dataquality checkes for entire zynga datasets.

work.summary: Technical lead for the development of session launch telemetry monitor which enables admins to earch session failures in any citrix virtual apps or virtual desktops by using the user id or transaction id and get the failure metdata and each event level details for both cloud and On premise customers at scale
highlights: Design architect for session launch telemetry monitor used by admins to find the root cause for all virtual desktop and app failures during session launch
Design and developed entire concept-spec on data of interest by admins and data representation
Designed seperate data flow to capture events from event hub and to process data in spark and store the data in druid to be used by monitor UI to serve the request by admins
Spark schema design and druid ingestion spec design to handle events at scale around 300 million event records/day
API design using exisitng C# wrapppers to provide feature specific API
Scale test the API using Python to ingest large mock events in druid data source and to test API performance to be ~ 5 req/sec

work.summary: Lead developer for open source analytics framework shannon and developer of Cisco Adaptive Test Sampling (CATS) system for global factory which saves 25% manufacturing test cost
highlights: Developer for open source advanced data analytic and visualization tool.
Developed a dashboard development framework called 'Shannon' leveraging existing open source Python visualization (Bokeh) and analytics (Pandas, h2o.ai, scikit-learn) libraries.
Built and deployed overall service infrastructure for Shannon utilizing Docker, Jenkins, Python, Gunicorn focusing on high-availability, fault tolerance, and auto-scaling.

Developed and implemented Adaptive Test Sampling algorithm (CATS) system in python which sample board to be tested in manufacturing based on the analysis of allowed escape rate and board quality risk.
Designed an overall automation service for structural In Circuit Test (ICT) risk analysis and grouping and sampling in python.
Deployed a centralized Telemetry system for Cisco catalyst product (InfluxDB) which gather system metrics.
Developed Value Added Time (VAT) algorithm to identify effective parallel test time, hence cost savings by going away from flat rate cost model.
LED test strategy development and implementation.

work.summary: Developed JTAG to IJTAG conversion library.Outcome from this work IJTAG library used in Cisco BIST
highlights: Migrating all CUSION libraries to new Tessent IJTAG standard and testing on Tessent IJTAG tool.
Validation of the generated patterns in simulation using VCS.
Designed a standard legacy library conversion methodology using TCL scripting.
Python script development to automate testing instruments like ECID and BIST for Cisco ASIC's. It enables remote connection to eMTP and remote testing

work.summary: Worked on Data warehousing for Union Bank of Scotland
